revised_title: The Influence of Bile and Its Constituents on Pancreatic Digestion
tldr: This study investigates the effect of bile and its constituents on pancreatic digestion, specifically the digestion of starch. The authors find that bile salts, such as taurocholate and glycocholate, enhance the amylolytic action of pancreatic enzymes on starch. They also observe that carbonate of sodium, when present in certain proportions, can retard pancreatic digestion, both with and without the presence of bile salts.
